title: What were the influential factors behind Donato's success in teaching magnetic fascination?
first_phrase: In this part of the text, the author recounts the success of Donato, a well-educated and knowledgeable man, married to a cultured and beautiful woman from a literate family, who attracts high society to his home and is respected by scientists, thanks to his ability to organize and present himself. The author praises Donato's honest and honorable methods, and invites readers to check out a book on magnetic fascination with a preface by Donato. The text ends with information on upcoming publications about magnetic fascination and a note on the author of the text, Charles Lafontaine, who was born in Vendôme on March 27, 1803 to a respected family of administrators.
content: » (1) Nous recommandons la Fascination magnétique, de M. Edouard Cavaillon, avec préface do Donato. Volume de 3 fr. 50, œuvre remarquable à tous les titres, publié par Dentu, au Palais-Royal, Paris. A NOS LECTEURS Nous publierons prochainement nos Leçons pratiques de fascination ainsi que nos Mémoir-es et la technologie du magnétisme humain. Nous nous arrangerons de telle sorte que notre première année forme un ouvrage complet pouvant remplacer avantageusement les meilleurs traités sur le magnétisme, tout en gardant son caractère de Revue. Donato. Le Gérant : Gkujon. PARIS.—IMF. CHARLES SCHLAEBER, 257, RUE SAINT-HONORE. CHARLES LAFONTAINE Ch. Lafontaine est né à Vendôme (1), le 27 mars 1803, d’une famille des plus honorables ; son père était administrateur.
last_phrase: In conclusion, for those interested in the practical application of magnetism and fascination, we recommend "Fascination Magnétique" by Edouard Cavaillon with a preface by Donato. Additionally, the publication of practical lessons and memoirs on the subject is forthcoming, promising to provide a comprehensive guide to human magnetism. Charles Lafontaine, the subject of this biographical excerpt, serves as an inspiring example of a curious and self-motivated individual who pursued his interests with vigor and dedication.
